page.title: 01Old Toll inland from Ayr
page.content: This area forms part of Ayr 'green belt' with no housing development allowed. It is cut off from the town by a busy by-pass but dependent upon Ayr for all services. The mild climate and high rainfall produce high quality grass which is the predominant feature of the landscape. It is intensively managed to provide grazing for sheep and cattle and to provde hay and silage crops for winter animal feed. Barley, turnips and rape are also grown and the houses are cottages or farm houses lived in by people employed on the land. Three utilities are also employers. Masonhill Crematorium caters for much of south west Scotland, there is a large electricity board complex, and Ailsa Hospital is the mental hopital for the disrict. Fields are bounded by hedges with some trees for game cover and
